p: The isolates from both sites grouped into 24 genera with a predominance of Streptomyces, followed by Nocardiopsis, Micrococcus, Kocuria, and others. Among these isolates, the number of these genera was four times as predominant from Tacheng than at the Ili site ( Figure 1). Six rare genera representative 5.56 % of all genera obtained— Agromyces, Alloactinosynnema, Labedella, Microbacterium, Mycobacterium, and Williamsia—were isolated only from Tacheng, while the five rare genera representative 4.76% of all genera obtained— Blastococcus, Dietzia, Micromonospora, Pseudarthrobacter, and Solirubrobacter—were isolated only from Ili site. These results indicated that there are some differences in the composition of endophytes from the same plant species in different geographical sites ( Figure 5).
